intro: [WRONG START] COLDENIA Plicata, commonly known as the New Zealand flax or kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves that are often used in traditional Māori weaving. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Coldenia plicata is also valued for its ecological role, providing habitat and food for native insects and birds.
